content:
You can use a product class to create products faster and more easily. Product classes already contain specific coverages, insured items, insured parties, rating facts, root product attributes, and rules.

To create a product model based on a product class, first create the initial product class-based root product spec.

After you create a product class-based root product spec, you can make some changes to the parts that are inherited from the product class. But some inherited things can't be changed on the root product spec.

When you associate a product class to an existing root product spec, the root product spec inherits all the coverages, insured items, insured parties, attributes, and rules from the parent class you select. These items add to whatever items are already present in the root product spec. They do not replace similar or identical items.

When you disassociate a product class from a root product spec, the inherited items from the product class are automatically removed from the root product spec.

To create a product class, see Creating Product Classes.

You can also clone products and configure networks on a root plan spec.

The insurance rules include taxes and fees, cloning products, custom numbering, trailing documents requirements, attribute rules, attribute value rules structure for batch loading, eligibility rules structure for batch loading, policy product management definitions, product JSON structure model, build rating procedures, create quotes, track commissions, manage insurance policies, manage claims, manage group benefits.
title: Product Modeling in Insurance
